item.title: Fortnite Festival Could Be the Perfect Blueprint for One Classic PlayStation Franchise's Revival
item.description:
Fortnite has evolved far beyond its early battle royale days. Epic Games' hit multiplayer game has quickly become a juggernaut in the industry, boasting a continuously growing roster of multiple games in one setting. From LEGO Fortnite to Fortnite Festival, the meteoric rise of Fortnite shows no signs of stopping.

The popularity of Fortnite has greatly influenced the gaming landscape, and the newer modes that continue to be included in the game are likely to inspire other developers. Fortnite Festival may not be an original idea, but it serves as a reminder of how fun rhythm games can be. This genre has been pushed aside in recent years, but Fortnite Festival makes a case for its return. Of course, Guitar Hero and Rock Band are some of the most notable rhythm games, but Fortnite Festival could set the stage for a classic PlayStation franchise revival; PaRappa the Rapper .

PaRappa the Rapper and Sony Should Take Notes From Fortnite Festival

Showcasing a PlayStation Classic in a Fresh Light

It's been a long time since PaRappa the Rapper made waves. An ill-fated remaster was released back in 2017, but there has yet to be a fresh take on the franchise. PaRappa the Rapper continues to be a charming reminder of how far games have come since the 90s. Its colorful cartoon aesthetic and simple rhythm controls made it a pioneer in the genre, and taking an online multiplayer route with the title could be the perfect way to bring the PlayStation icon back from the grave.

While it could be possible for Fortnite to eventually collaborate with PaRappa the Rapper in Fortnite Festival, Sony going the extra mile and bringing its own full-blown online multiplayer rhythm experience could serve as fun competition. Bringing back PaRappa the Rapper 's cast of characters with overhauled mechanics has the potential to breathe new life into the series. There may not be much room for PaRappa the Rapper in the world of premium games anymore, but a free-to-play multiplayer entry where players can rack up in-game rewards may work wonders.

The first PaRappa the Rapper game was released in 1997, and its sequel launched in 2001. Although the series has received ports, a third installment has yet to be released.

A Live-Service PaRappa the Rapper Could Take Inspiration From Fortnite Festival's Features

  • Character cosmetics
  • Premium songs
  • Instrument cosmetics

Fortnite Festival's approach to the rhythm genre has set up a solid formula to bring back players with its continuously added content. Although Fortnite 's embrace of microtransactions can be controversial, PaRappa the Rapper could compete with this by making most of its awards more easily achievable through building XP instead of in-game currency and purchases. Instead, more traditional microtransactions could be spared for the most exclusive content, like major hit songs.

The Legacy of PaRappa the Rapper Lives On

While PaRappa the Rapper may not boast a long history of releases, its influence on the industry cannot be mistaken. From PaRappa 's cameo in Astro Bot to helping pioneer the entire rhythm genre, PaRappa the Rapper holds icon status for a good reason. It's unclear if PaRappa the Rapper will ever get a second chance at making a statement in the industry, but there could also be a surprise waiting on the horizon.

There was even a PaRappa the Rapper animated series that ran from 2001 to 2002 and spanned 30 episodes.

Over the summer, there were rumors making rounds on the internet that a new PaRappa the Rapper starring Playboi Carti was being developed by Sony, but this remains unconfirmed. Since rumors and leaks should be taken with a grain of salt, such a revival still seems unlikely at the moment, but one can always hope.

item.title: The Sims 4: 13 Best Mods For The Decades Challenge
item.description:
Summary

  • Legacy challenges enhance gameplay in The Sims 4 by emphasizing creativity, storytelling, and historical accuracy.
  • Mods provide realism and depth to the Decades Challenge through custom careers, traits, and historical details.
  • Historical mods offer immersive experiences by introducing challenges, diseases, and traditions reflecting different eras.

The Decades Challenge is a popular legacy challenge where players guide their Sims through the eras, starting in the 1890s and advancing decade by decade while adapting to the changing historical norms, technology, and lifestyles of the times. This unique The Sims 4 challenge emphasizes creativity, storytelling, and historical accuracy, requiring players to mimic real-world events and societal shifts.

While the base game provides a foundation, mods can enhance the experience by adding realism, historical details, and new mechanics tailored to specific time periods. From custom careers and traits to reimagined worlds and intricate gameplay systems, mods help players dive deeper into their historical narratives. These tools bring added depth and immersion, allowing for more engaging and authentic gameplay as Sims evolve through the decades.

Several mods on this list have dependencies. The required DLC packs and mod files have been displayed and must be downloaded for the mod to function properly in the game. Ensure that script mods have been enabled in the game's settings. Refer to the creator's website for installation assistance and further information.

13 Simverses Medieval CC

Step Into History With Timely Fashion Masterpieces

  • Created by Simverses
  • Download Here (Tumblr)

Simverses Medieval CC is a treasure trove of historical custom content, featuring hundreds of meticulously designed clothing, hairstyles, and accessories inspired by eras like the Medieval period, Tudor Renaissance, Viking age, and more. Whether it's outfitting a noble family, a group of peasants, or Viking warriors, Simverses allows Simmers to pick and choose styles that perfectly suit any story, culture, or era.

Custom content like this is crucial for the Decades Challenge, as it showcases the evolution of fashion and helps characters look authentic to their time period. The attention to detail in every piece creates an unparalleled level of immersion, bringing historical gameplay to the present. With Simverses, players can craft a world where their Sims truly feel like they’ve stepped out of the pages of history.

12 SDA Nursery Sets

Setting The Scene For Historical Homes

  • Created by Medieval Sim Tailor & Carpenter
  • Download Part 1 Here (Patreon)
  • Download Part 2 Here (Patreon)

Custom furniture sets like the SDA Nursery Sets are a must-have for players looking to create authentic historical homes in The Sims 4 . Spanning two separate parts, this comprehensive custom content collection features furniture for children and toddlers, such as charming crafting tables and toy boxes, alongside general furniture like single beds, sofas, loveseats, tables, and chairs.

Designed with vintage styles in mind, these pieces are perfect for setting the scene in earlier decades of the Decades Challenge. Furniture and object custom content like this enhances the challenge by creating a cohesive aesthetic that immerses players in the period they’re recreating. With these sets, Sims’ homes can be transformed into a stunning snapshot of the past, down to the smallest detail.

11 80s Set

Bright Neon, Big Hair, And Endless Fun

  • Created by gloomytrait & lilacdreamers
  • Requires: The Sims 4: Seasons
  • Download Here (Sims File Share)

Bring the 1980s to life in The Sims 4 with this free vibrant mod pack, designed to capture the iconic fashion and aesthetics of the decade. Featuring 40 new Create-A-Sim items, interactive objects, and even a new WooHoo spot, this pack has everything needed to recreate the energy and nostalgia of the era. The colorful outfits, bold hairstyles, and retro-inspired interior items make it a perfect addition for this challenge, helping players seamlessly transition their Sims into the bold and carefree vibe of the 80s.

From restored The Sims 3 items like the functional claw machine and dancefloor to new activities like roller skating with neon skates, this pack is loaded with options to immerse Sims in the era. Whether they're jamming on an electric guitar, busting moves on the boombox, or cozying up in their car, Sims will truly feel like they've stepped into a slice of 80s paradise.

10 Medieval Windenburg Mod

Step Into A World Of Knights And Castles

  • Created by TheSenseMedieval
  • Requires: The Sims 4: Get Together
  • Download Here (Tumblr)

Transform Windenburg into a captivating medieval realm with this stunning mod that reimagines the world from the Get Together expansion. Through intricate retextures, replacement models, a redesigned map, and the removal of modern elements, this mod creates a seamless historical setting for Sims. Similar to downloading and playing in new save files, the Medieval Windenburg Mod is perfect for players who want to dive straight into a richly detailed environment without the hassle of creating one from scratch.

Whether players are not confident in their building skills or simply prefer to focus on storytelling, this mod provides an immersive backdrop for life in the medieval era. With its charming blend of castles, villages, and period-appropriate landscapes, Sims can truly live out their historical adventures in style.

9 All Worlds Are Residential

Living Anywhere, Building Stories Everywhere

  • Created by Zerbu
  • Download Here (Tumblr)

The All Worlds Are Residential mod unlocks the ability to turn any destination world in The Sims 4 into a residential haven for Sims. Whether it's settling in the serene wilderness of Granite Falls or embracing the rich history of Selvadorada, players can now create homes in worlds previously reserved for vacations and outdoor adventures.

This flexibility is invaluable for storytellers recreating different eras, as it expands the variety of settings where Sims can live and thrive. Instead of limiting Sims to modern neighborhoods, players can fully immerse themselves in unique and time-appropriate environments. From remote cabins to ancient villages, this mod ensures Sims' homes perfectly complement their evolving narratives.

8 Historical Mods

Challenge And Realism For Every Era

  • Created by Zero's Sims 4 Mods
  • Download Here (Patreon)

The Historical Mods are a game-changer for anyone looking to add depth and realism to their historical gameplay. With seven distinct mods, this collection enhances the challenge by removing modern conveniences and introducing historically inspired mechanics. From Candles Last Twice, which extends the life of handmade candles, to Mop the Dust, which replaces vacuums with manual cleaning, these mods ensure Sims live authentically within the constraints of their time.

The Deadly Dickensian Sicknesses mod adds a dramatic layer of risk with four Victorian-era diseases, while No Fire Insurance forces Sims to bear the financial burden of fire damage, just as they would in the past. Whether it’s manually weeding gardens or contending with blighted crops, these mods immerse players in the hardships and triumphs of a bygone age, making historical storytelling richer and more engaging.

7 Handcrafted Dyes & Wool

Bring Realism, Tradition, And Creativity To Sims’ Crafting Skills

  • Created by Littlbowbub
  • Requires: Homestead Helper Mod (Patreon), The Sims 4: Eco Lifestyle , and The Sims 4: Cottage Living
  • Download Here (Patreon)

The Handcrafted Dyes & Wool mod is a fantastic addition for Sims pursuing creative hobbies in the Decades Challenge, whether in the early eras or modern ones. By removing the need for computers, this mod stays true to historical immersion while allowing Sims to craft dyes for knitting, cross-stitching, and fabricating.

Using the new Homestead Helper Basket, Sims can create natural dyes on a stove, adding a hands-on element to their crafting routine. This mod fits perfectly with the self-sufficient lifestyle of earlier decades, while also serving as a meaningful tradition for Sims in later generations. It’s a beautiful way to blend creativity, history, and storytelling across time.

6 Hunting & Foraging

Live Off The Land And Embrace A Simpler Way Of Life

  • Created by Littlbowbub
  • Download Here (Patreon)

The Hunting & Foraging mod is perfect for the earliest decades of the challenge, where Sims must rely on nature to survive. This immersive mod lets Sims explore new areas, like "The Forest" for hunting, "The Mountains" for mining, and "The Docks" for fishing and gathering water.

With the new Hunting and Foraging skills, Sims can provide for their families by catching rabbits, gathering herbs, and crafting supplies. The dynamic weather system adds realism, as harsh winters make food harder to come by. Whether crafting bait at the Hunter’s Crafting Table or foraging for essential resources, this mod captures the struggle and resourcefulness of life before modern conveniences.

5 Medieval Cookbook

Cooking Recipes From A Bygone Era

  • Created by Littlbowbub
  • Requires: Homestead Helper Mod (Patreon) and Starter Medieval Cookbook Recipes (Patreon)
  • Download Here (Patreon)

The Medieval Cookbook Mod is a must-have food mod for the Decades Challenge, especially for households with the Off The Grid lot trait. This mod introduces a variety of historically inspired recipes and traditional cooking methods, perfect for capturing the simplicity of pre-modern kitchens.

Players can purchase the cookbook in Build/Buy mode to unlock these old-world meals, adding authenticity to Sims’ daily lives. As the challenge progresses, the evolving recipes reflect the passage of time and culinary advancements. With ongoing updates and new recipes promised by the creator, this mod ensures Sims’ cooking stays fresh — even in the past.

4 Enlist In War Mod

Bringing History’s Battles To Gameplay

  • Created by Kuttoe
  • Download Here (itch.io)

This mod simplifies one of the most pivotal aspects of historical challenges: sending Sims off to war. Designed with rules like those in the Decades Challenge in mind, it allows Sims to register for the draft, leave for a few days, and return with their fate decided by a 50/50 chance of survival. Surviving Sims earn the Veteran trait, complete with a weekly pension and emotional depth through occasional negative moodlets.

For Sims who don't make it, the game delivers an impactful goodbye as they pass away at home. Beyond the challenge, the Enlist In War Mod enhances storytelling and roleplay, offering players a meaningful way to explore the emotional and generational effects of war on their Sims and their legacies. Rather than relying on cheats and a low-risk military career, players can use this mod to aid their journey with this challenge.

3 Child Birth Mod

Bringing Realism To Pregnancy And Parenting Across The Ages

  • Created by PandaSama
  • Download Here (pandasama)

For a deeply immersive experience, the Child Birth Mod lets players explore the evolution of pregnancy and childbirth throughout history. From home births and natural deliveries in earlier eras to the advent of cesarean sections and modern medical interventions, this mod mirrors the changes in how labor and pregnancy have been managed over the decades.

Sims can host gender reveal parties or attend Lamaze classes, capturing the growing cultural significance of pregnancy milestones in modern times. Beyond the birth itself, traditions like playing music for the baby bump or celebrating the arrival of a newborn reflect the timeless joy of family. This mod enhances realism and storytelling for historical challenges by tying pregnancy experiences to the era-specific practices and customs that define each generation.

2 Healthcare Redux

A Comprehensive Health System To Deepen Sims' Stories

  • Created by adeepindigo
  • Requires: The Sims 4: Get To Work , General Pie Menus Mod (itch.io) & The Mood Pack (Sims File Share)
  • Download Here (itch.io)

Bringing depth and realism to Sims' health, the Healthcare Redux Mod offers a wide range of features that align seamlessly with historical storytelling. Sims are randomly assigned immune system levels, which affect their susceptibility to illnesses and the duration of their recovery.

Chronic conditions like diabetes, arthritis, and deafness add layers of complexity to Sims' lives, mirroring the health challenges of different eras. Players can also explore realistic medical emergencies, injuries, and even prenatal care, reflecting the evolution of healthcare practices across time periods. For the Decades Challenge, this mod enriches gameplay by introducing historical accuracy to health struggles, medical advancements, and how Sims experience and overcome these challenges through the ages.

1 Royalty Mod

Transform Sims' Worlds With Regal Intrigue And Historical Depth

  • Created by llazyneiph
  • Requires: Frankk's Pack Test Script (Frankkmods), XML Injector (Scumbumbo), and MAL22 Trait Injector (itch.io)
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

With The Sims 4: Get Famous , Sims can become famous, but mods like the Royalty Mod can take it a step further. Transform historical gameplay by creating monarchies, establishing noble titles, and exploring class dynamics with depth. Its features, like succession, taxes, and royal events such as coronations and audiences, bring authenticity to royal narratives. Players can incorporate court intrigue with advisors, knights, and squires or add drama through duels, poison plots, and public executions.

With careers for peasants, nobles, and royalty, along with dynamic class traits based on wealth and property, this mod seamlessly integrates historical authenticity into Sims' lives. Perfect for evolving the Decades Challenge into a Royal Decades Challenge, it allows players to explore the grandeur and struggles of ruling through the ages.

item.title: Krafton Details New Franchise IP Strategy
item.description:
Summary

  • Krafton plans to expand first-party production to secure new franchise IPs.
  • "Second Party Publishing and Licensing" tactics will be employed for user base growth.
  • The company aims to secure a new "Big Franchise IP" to build on PUBG's success.

South Korean publisher Krafton Inc. has laid out its 2025 business strategy, outlining its intended approach to management, resource allocation, IP acquisition, first-party game development, and more. Krafton serves as both publisher and parent company to PUBG: Battlegrounds , the hugely successful battle royal game developed by its subsidiary PUBG Studios.

The games industry giant, which is currently valued at over $10 Billion USD, has acquired a number of studios and IPs since its 2018 inception and has had a hand in the development and release of a wide range of titles, including The Callisto Protocol , [REDACTED] , New State Mobile , and Moonbreaker . Krafton also recently bought out the shuttered Tango Gameworks, formerly under Microsoft control, along with the right to any future games in the Hi-Fi Rush franchise.

During a company-wide town hall meeting onJanuary 16, 2025, Krafton announced its plans to expand first-party production in an effort to secure new franchise IPs. The company intends to step up investment in its 14 creative studios to increase its output of new releases and entice industry talent. Alongside an expanded slate of new releases, the company is also looking to incorporate so-called "Second Party Publishing and Licensing" tactics as it seeks to grow existing user bases for both new and current IPs, like Krafton's upcoming Subnautica 2 , from Unknown Worlds.

Krafton Looks to New and Old Franchises for Continued Growth

Citing "mid-to-long-term objectives and sustainable growth" as key motivators, the company also outlined its intentions to change up its management system and prioritize efficiency in its resource allocation across the entire development lifecycle. As stated by CEO Kim Chang-han, “Our new titles will officially launch starting this year. We are fully committed to securing a new ‘Big Franchise IP’ that will build on the success of PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS ."

With Krafton's realistic life simulator i nZOI announced at Gamescom 2024, and mobile versions of Dark and Darker and Palworld in development due to recent Krafton partnerships, the company looks to be gearing up for a significant expansion across a variety of markets. The diversification of interests and reluctance to rely on its flagship IPs could also be seen as insurance against the games industry contraction of 2023-24.

Despite the critical failure of Krafton's Callisto Protocol , the company seems well-positioned to continue its steady increase in market value. Its recent investments in a number of new studios and non-gaming ventures point toward a company that's both able to absorb the occasional misstep and primed to maintain its track record of expansion. What exactly its new banner IP will look like is hard to tell, given the broad array of genres it's dabbled in thus far, but whatever it is will likely arrive with fanfare that's difficult to miss.

item.title: Yakuza 0 Proves a Serious Majima Game Isn’t an Impossibility
item.description:
This article contains SPOILERS for Yakuza 0 and Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth .

Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii is set to see Goro Majima headline a game once again, this time as an amnesiac pirate captain sailing around the Hawaiian islands. The wacky premise and tone of Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii are fitting for the character, and serve as a nice contrast to the much more emotional stories of the previous games in the series, Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name and Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth . However, this doesn't mean a serious game starring Majima could never work, and one fan-favorite entry in the franchise proves this.

Recently, Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio chief producer Hiroyuki Sakamoto claimed in an interview with TheGamer that "you can't make a serious Majima game" and that any game made around him is going to be over the top. While it's largely true that Majima is one of the franchise's most over-the-top characters, Yakuza 0 showed a much more subdued side of him that helped elevate him to the fan-favorite character he is today. Ignoring the success of Majima's story in Yakuza 0 does a disservice to the character, and he shouldn't be disqualified from having a more serious game again in the future.

While Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii's Wacky Nature is Welcome, A Serious Majima Game Shouldn't Be Off the Table

Majima's Yakuza 0 Portrayal Shows the Character Can Be at His Best with a Serious Tone

While fans have become accustomed to Majima's antics over the years due to his portrayal as the Mad Dog of Shimano, he hasn't always carried this persona. Yakuza 0 serves as a prequel to the series wherein Majima is forced to play the role of cabaret club owner as a punishment for his failure during the infamous Ueno Siwa Hit. During this time, Majima takes on his Lord of the Night persona, leaning into the suave club owner and bowing to the whims of club patrons in order to earn enough money to wipe away his debut and rejoin the Tojo Clan.

Despite first portraying Majima as a wacky side character through his Majima Everywhere side quest in the original Yakuza game, the growth his character undergoes during the events of Yakuza 0 shows he has the potential to be far more well-rounded than the one-dimensional over-the-top character the series tends to portray him as. In fact, it's through his efforts to protect Makoto Makimura, rather than assassinate her as he was ordered to do, that Majima grows into a character that many fans find far more interesting than he was previously. His Mad Dog persona largely grew out of a response to feeling caged by his duties at the Grand Cabaret in Sotenbori, and other glimpses of a serious Majima can be seen in flashbacks throughout the series.

Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii's Amnesia Plot Would Have Been Perfect for a Serious Majima Game

The Mad Dog persona has started slipping again in the post-Great Dissolution era of Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth , and an aging Majima working as a fisherman alongside Saejima and Dojima in Hokkaido looks far different from the zany character of the series' past. With Majima waking up on Rich Island with amnesia at the start of Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii , it would make sense for his Mad Dog persona to have slipped away even more. Instead, Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii seems to double down on this persona, which while fun for many fans, misses the opportunity to tell another serious Majima story.

Without the knowledge of his past to motivate the Mad Dog, seeing Majima regress into his pre- Yakuza 0 personality would have delivered an interesting take on the character. It's not often that players get to see that version of Majima, so even if Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii does not embrace that side, another prequel game starring Majima should still be on the table in the future.
